ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: The class teaches new grammars and provides an opportunity to talk in order to get more comfortable speaking.

The benefit of this course using popular Korean media as teaching material is that the grammar and vocabulary covered are both interesting and useful. Though I rarely listened to KPop before taking the course, Professor Lee-Smith chose melodically appealing songs that told meaningful stories. We learned how to talk about love in class in addition to discussing the meaning behind the movie Parasite. This is a wonderful class.
I learned a lot about grammar and culture

I learned a lot about Korean culture, particularly media and songs. We learned how to make our own lyrics for K-pop songs and interpret existing songs that we know, which was super cool as the songs can be very abstract! I never expected to learn about this in Korean, and it was very fun to learn as a class.
I learned more Korean grammar as well as explored a lot of different Korean music.
My Korean speaking and listening skills were developed in this class!
New vocabulary and grammar structures in Korean

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: This course is strong thanks to the professors enthusiasm and commitment to our learning. Everyone was eager to learn and ask questions, which often prompted random vocabulary and grammar concepts to be learned, in addition to our planned material. I also really enjoyed the project-based format because it encourages creativity and taking risks with language.
The professor! She is such a sweet heart!
Really engaging material and fun classes!
Strengths: Incredibly kind professor. You will not regret taking a course with Angela Lee-Smith!

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes! I wasnt familiar with Korean music, but I didnt feel that was a problem in this class. Its very much focused on learning Korean language. Professor Lee provided a very warm and welcoming classroom environment that allowed me to learn.

Yes yes yes. Especially after a study abroad experience, this is the perfect course to continue advanced learning of Korean. The Professor is amazing and fosters an encouraging, friendly environment conducive to learning.
Yes! Would definitely recommend if you want a relaxed but engaging class.
Yes! This is a great class for anyone studying Korean.
I would definitely recommend this class taught by Angela Lee-Smith. She was a fantastic and patient instructor.

Yes, absolutely!! This class was so chill and enjoyable, and Angela Lee-Smith is an amazing professor. This class tends to have less structured homework (e.g. grammar practice/exercises), but I still felt that I improved in Korean by practicing speaking and listening in class and in TA sessions.
